title: Sound On: Impeachment, Religious-School Aid Case
itunes:title: Sound On: Impeachment, Religious-School Aid Case
description:
Guest host Greg Stohr, Bloomberg Supreme Court reporter discussed the lastest impeachment news with guests Bob Barr, former Republican Georgia Congressman and former House Manager for the impeachment of President Bill Clinton and Bloomberg politics editor Anna Edgerton.


Greg also discussed the Montana case before the U.S. Supreme Court that could make it easier to funnel public money to religious schools and other faith-based organizations. He spoke with Daniel Mach, Director of the ACLU’s Program for Freedom of Religion and Belief and Michael Bindas, Senior attorney with the Institute for Justice.


Kevin Cirilli spoke to Secretary of State Mike Pompeo in an exclusive interview from Jamaica about President Trump’s impeachment trial and foreign policy.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
